# Ardo

> React-first Static Documentation Framework built on React 19, TanStack Start, and Vite 8.

Ardo combines the developer experience of VitePress with the power of the React ecosystem. Write documentation in Markdown, use React components, and deploy as a static site.

## Package Exports

- `ardo/config` — Configuration utilities (`defineConfig`, `resolveConfig`, `loadConfig`)
- `ardo/vite` — Vite plugin (`ardoPlugin`)
- `ardo/runtime` — React hooks (`useConfig`, `useThemeConfig`, `useSidebar`, `usePageData`, `useTOC`)
- `ardo/theme` — Pre-built UI components (Layout, Header, Sidebar, TOC, Footer, DocPage, CodeBlock, etc.)
- `ardo/theme/styles.css` — Default theme stylesheet
- `ardo/typedoc` — TypeDoc generation utilities (`typedocPlugin`, `generateApiDocs`)

## Quick Start

```bash
# Scaffold a new project (recommended)
pnpm create ardo@latest my-docs

# Or install manually
pnpm add ardo @tanstack/react-start @tanstack/react-router react react-dom
pnpm add -D typescript vite tailwindcss
```

## Key Concepts

- Configuration via `press.config.ts` using `defineConfig()` from `ardo/config`
- Vite plugin via `ardoPlugin()` from `ardo/vite`
- Markdown content lives in a `content/` directory
- JSX-first architecture: theme components accept explicit props
- Supports both config-driven sidebar/nav and JSX composition
- Built-in full-text search via MiniSearch
- Dark mode via CSS custom properties
- TypeDoc integration for API reference generation
